item.title: [BEAM-6102] Dataflow cannot deserialize DoFns - incompatible serialVersionUID (JDK or code version mismatch)
item.description:
The wordcount is broken on the master.

Its failing with serialization error mentioned below

item.summary: Dataflow cannot deserialize DoFns - incompatible serialVersionUID (JDK or code version mismatch)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Is this a release blocker ?
Definitely a release blocker - the results of https://builds.apache.org/view/A-D/view/Beam/job/beam_PostRelease_NightlySnapshot/ would imply that the quickstart does not work on Dataflow right now.
Is this related to the previous serialization problems due to BEAM-5299?

I looked at a failing job and extracted a copy of the org/apache/beam/sdk/values/WindowingStrategy.class file which came from beam-sdks-java-core-2.9.0-SNAPSHOT-Aoyvg0doZsYvr7jINSJAKA.jar WindowingStrategy.class
I pulled down the gcr.io/cloud-dataflow/v1beta3/beam-java-batch:beam-master-20181116 docker container and there is no org/apache/beam/sdks/values/WindowingStrategy.class file contained within it.
Note that the WindowingStrategy.class does have one of the two reported serialVersionUids which makes me suspect that its related to one of the fields that are part of the serial version uid.

I attempted to fetch the serial version uid using the following program:

import java.io.ObjectStreamClass;

public class a {
  public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
    System.out.println(args[0] + ": " + ObjectStreamClass.lookup(Class.forName(args[0])).getSerialVersionUID());
  }
}

using my local JVM (1.8.0_161), the JVM (1.8.0_122-ea-b02) from the Dataflow worker, and the JDK that was used to build and run the tests 1.8.0_191. All of them generate -6607512772692666907L as the serial version uid.

I pushed up some changes fixing some of the Dataflow worker shading rules and clarifying some of the details to my branch https://github.com/lukecwik/incubator-beam/tree/beam6102, still need to test it out.

I pushed up some changes fixing some of the Dataflow worker shading rules and clarifying some of the details to my branch https://github.com/lukecwik/incubator-beam/tree/beam6102, still need to test it out.

Curiously, when running WordCount using --streaming, the error is:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.beam.model.pipeline.v1.RunnerApi$BeamConstants$Constants.getValueDescriptor()Lorg/apache/beam/vendor/grpc/v1_13_1/com/google/protobuf/Descriptors$EnumValueDescriptor; 
  	at org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.windowing.BoundedWindow.extractTimestampFromProto(BoundedWindow.java:84) 
  	at org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.windowing.BoundedWindow.<clinit>(BoundedWindow.java:49) 
  	at org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.worker.WindmillTimeUtils.windmillToHarnessTimestamp(WindmillTimeUtils.java:49) 
  	at org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.worker.WindmillTimeUtils.windmillToHarnessWatermark(WindmillTimeUtils.java:34) 
  	at org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.worker.StreamingDataflowWorker.dispatchLoop(StreamingDataflowWorker.java:902) 
  	at org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.worker.StreamingDataflowWorker.access$200(StreamingDataflowWorker.java:143) 
  	at org.apache.beam.runners.dataflow.worker.StreamingDataflowWorker$1.run(StreamingDataflowWorker.java:588) 
  	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
